caption: (Translated by Google) The food is amazing! The staff are so nice and friendly! The taste is typical Chinese style, rather than American Chinese food. There are different choices at reasonable prices, ranging from meat bowls and vegetables dishes. There is some orders for your reference. The store is not far from the Foggy Bottom station, GW University and the Lincoln. If you are finding something hot to eat, it is a good choice for you to drop in. This is really a good Chinese fast food. The food is delicious and the manager is warm and highly recommended. It feels like a restaurant in the cafeteria of the University of Washington. Many students come to eat, but it is also open to the public. The meals were plenty. Looking at a small bowl, the vegetables and meat were adequate, the prices were fair, and hot water was available. The location is not far from the fog valley subway station or the Lincoln Memorial. I have been planning to use this shop as a base for a week in Washington. I have eaten two meals and have not stepped on the mine.  (Original) The food is amazing! The staff are so nice and friendly! The taste is typical Chinese style, rather than American Chinese food. There are different choices at reasonable prices, ranging from meat bowls and vegetables dishes. There is some orders for your reference. The store is not far from the Foggy Bottom station, GW University and the Lincoln. If you are finding something hot to eat, it is a good choice for you to drop in. 这真是一家很不错的中式快餐了。饭好吃店长热情，五星好评推荐。感觉像是华盛顿大学的食堂里面的餐厅吧，很多学生来吃饭，不过也对外开放。饭量很足，看着不很大的一碗，蔬菜和肉类都很足，价格也很公道，还可以给打热水。 地址位置优越，和雾谷地铁站或者林肯纪念堂都不算很远。在华盛顿的一周已经打算好把这家店当作据点了，已经吃过了两顿还没有踩雷。
(Translated by Google) Best Asian restaurant at me  (Original) Best Asian restaurant at gw

First of all the sign is misleading... “a whole grain cuisine”.  I was expecting some more healthy...like grain bowls, salads or something. But It sadly wasn’t.  It was very disappointing. The meat was super salty and the noodles were oily and flavorless. I also got the Mango bubble tea which tasted like some kind of powdered mango mix...that wasn’t blended well, because it was gritty. It didn’t even drink it all.

I don't know how a real Chinese owner from Fujian can cook such undescribable things to their fellow Chinese people without feeling guilt. If I rate panda express 2 out of 10 this is 2E-9 out of 10. Holy macro.
Food is okay, I saw the employee working the register continuously go from the register to handling the food without washing her hands.

The people who run this business clearly want it to succeed and give it their all with their customer service. The food also looks amazing and is priced just right. Unfortunately it just doesn't taste very good. I had the sweet and sour chicken bowl with chow mein on the proprietors' recommendation and the sauce was cloyingly sweet -- most likely ketchup-based. Whatever noodles that weren't covered in sauce tasted oily and flavorless, like it came out of a ramen packet.  I was so excited that a Chinese food eatery replaced the previously dismal Pita Pit but it looks like this specific retail space is doomed to mediocrity
Amazing delicious food and superb service.  This place is a gem and the sesame balls are to die for!
